title: Bug 120922: 'Dirty Page' behavior in XML Report Designer editor needs improvement
description: When editing XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor and then attempting to switch back to the Layout view, an error message is displayed stating that the changes need to be saved. The problem is that the user is not provided with clear instructions on how to save or discard their changes. The error message, titled 'Error', is displayed with quotation marks. The user is then presented with the options to save the changes by selecting 'Yes', discard the changes by selecting 'No', or cancel the action by selecting 'Cancel'. Selecting 'Yes' saves the changes, selecting 'No' discards the changes, and selecting 'Cancel' does nothing and remains on the Source page.
OB: When editing the XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor and attempting to switch back to the Layout view, an error message is displayed stating the need to save the changes. The user is required to determine how to save or discard the changes, which can be difficult. The error message displayed is 'Source page is dirty.'
EB: Upon editing the XML in the 'source' view of the Layout Editor and trying to switch back to the Layout view, a clear and informative error message should be displayed, guiding the user on how to save or discard the changes. The error message should not include quotation marks and should be more descriptive. Additionally, the dialog title should be changed from 'Error' to a more appropriate title.
SR:
To reproduce the issue, follow these steps:
1. Open the XML Report Designer.
2. Switch to the 'source' view of the Layout Editor.
3. Make changes to the XML.
4. Attempt to switch back to the Layout view.
5. Observe the error message that prompts to save the changes.
